title: What happened to Riot Games Japan?
body:
What happened to Riot Games Japan?
I know, there was official plan to launch server at 5th May 2015. Since that didn't happen, does it mean Japan isn't getting its own server in the end?
Can we have any news from Riot?
You could save me and other japanese players some time...
I'm searching for any news possible - related to japanese server - everyday... there's nothing.

In one week there is Japanese League season 2 start. Sadly, many players in Japan feel disappointed - that there is no server still, and ignored - since you don't share any information about server work progress (if there is any).

replies.body: This does seem pretty important. Japan could be another major front in the LCS/pro series but without their own server they cant' get the recognition they deserve.

Indeed
Japanese were so impatient, waiting for the server, that they've made mistake - creating "pro" teams and Japanese League. Only to be recognized as worst region in the world.
Ofc there is that illusion, that we have japanese teams, league and everything is fine... when in fact we are losing more and more potential, future pro players everyday, tired of waiting for japanese server.

Even, if there will be japanese server in the future I will have noone to start with. Since all my friends switched to other games, after waiting years for japanese server or any news about it.
I think that Riot is making huge mistake by not informing us about, what is going on with Riot Games Tokyo. A bit of news last year was not enough to make most of japanese players stay and keep waiting still... They've left feeling disappointed... Like there was no progress at all.
Please Riot, save what's left and open to us a little bit!

Dunno, but all I can say is this:

1. Based on my knowledge Japan is hard to break into for a foreign company.  So there might have been some cultural or legal roadblock slowing riot down.
2. As the turn of Konami to mobile devices and the popularity of the DS over there have shown, Japan's preference in how you play games is important too.  So trying to break a PC online game into a market that I think is starting to favor mobile devices is a hard business decision to make.

You know, that Japanese people love their cuisine, they prefer to eat everything that's traditional japanese food.
Most of them are against fast - unhealthy - food.
Many years ago noone could imagine how easy it will be for a foreign companies to come here, with their McDonalds and KFC everywhere around.

Another example:
Still, few years ago everyone prefered mobile phones only made in Japan (for Japanese use only)... now - almost everyone have Apple's Iphone.
Please don't tell us how "hard it is to break into Japan for a foreign company"...

Have you seen Riot's marketing plan for Japan at least?
Because, you're talking, as if Riot was just about to make decision now - go to Japan or not... when, in fact, they're already in Japan for more than one year... all tests for a game and server in Japan are done and all we need is "press the launch button".
They were planning to launch the server in Japan for 5/5/2015 - two weeks ago - it was Children Festival day for Japan (Golden Week). Perfect date for a start... but that didn't happen, and we want to know why?

Plase, can we get any official information from Riot about Riot Games Tokyo?
Trust me, all players in Japan are tired - reading all this divagations from people that know nothing about Japan and Riot Games in Japan, but they pretend to be connoisseur of Japanese culture.

Here it is, Marketing Plan for Japan:
http://www.slideshare.net/PhuvadolUewongtrakoo/marketing-plan-league-of-legends-enter-japanese-market

Riot Games in America and Riot Games Tokyo are different people, they work for different server and different society.
